radiographic_examinations.findings: A large multinodular goiter continued to grow, requiring thyroidectomy. The right lobe was totally resected, except for a small thyroid nodule encircling the right recurrent nerve. The left lobe was partially resected except for a 2 cm x 0.5 cm patch of thyroid tissue close to the left recurrent nerve.
radiographic_examinations.changes_over_time: After surgery, a relapse of hyperthyroidism occurred within 2 weeks, necessitating the resumption of carbimazole treatment. Radioiodine therapy was administered 2 years later to control the growth of thyroid tissue from the small thyroid remnants.

radiographic_examinations.findings: Radioiodine therapy administered to control the growth of thyroid tissue from the small thyroid remnants.
radiographic_examinations.changes_over_time: After radioiodine therapy, thyroid hormone levels gradually decreased, and hypothyroidism was observed, requiring L-T4 substitution.
